perturbation.original_text: This agreement shall remain in full force and effect until revoked by any party hereto in a signed writing provided to each other party hereto, and then only with respect to such revoking party.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement shall remain in full force and effect until revoked by any party hereto in a signed writing provided to each other party hereto. Revocation shall be effective immediately for all parties upon receipt of such notice by any one party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states revocation is only effective for the revoking party. The modified text contradicts this by stating that revocation is effective immediately for *all* parties upon notice to any one party. This creates uncertainty as to whether the agreement continues for non-revoking parties.

perturbation.original_text: Pursuant to and in accordance with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and the rules and regulations thereunder, each party hereto hereby agrees to the joint filing, on behalf of each of them, of any filing required by such party under Section 13 or Section 16 of the Exchange Act or any rule or regulation thereunder (including any amendment, restatement, supplement, and/or exhibit thereto) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (and, if such security is registered on a national securities exchange, also with the exchange), and further agrees to the filing, furnishing, and/or incorporation by reference of this agreement as an exhibit thereto.
perturbation.changed_text: Pursuant to and in accordance with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and the rules and regulations thereunder, each party hereto hereby agrees to the joint filing, on behalf of each of them, of any filing required by such party under Section 13 or Section 16 of the Exchange Act or any rule or regulation thereunder (including any amendment, restatement, supplement, and/or exhibit thereto) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (and, if such security is registered on a national securities exchange, also with the exchange), and further agrees to the filing, furnishing, and/or incorporation by reference of this agreement as an exhibit thereto. However, each party retains the right to independently file amendments under Section 13, should they deem it necessary.
perturbation.explanation: The original text establishes a mandatory joint filing agreement. The addition of the sentence 'However, each party retains the right to independently file amendments under Section 13, should they deem it necessary' introduces a contradiction. It creates ambiguity as to whether joint filing is always required or if individual parties can bypass the agreement for Section 13 amendments, thus undermining the enforceability of the original joint filing obligation.
